description:
Within the context of constructing self, communal and national identities, heritage is of great interest to varying groups of peoples and institutions in societies. Drawing 
examples from Southeast Asia and beyond, this module looks at the multiple and sometimes conflicting meanings attached to heritage by different stakeholders and consumers. It highlights inequities in the control of heritage objects, places and practices. It pays attention to strategies of fostering discourse between the various 
stakeholders.
title: Heritage: Peoples and Institutions
